interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Follow Me, Boys!
Review Date: 2013/01/15
Store: Fred MacMurray  (Actor),     Vera Miles  (Actor),     Norman Tokar  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
Product Description: ['After one year too many on the road with a ramshackle jazz band, Lem Siddons (Fred MacMurray) decides to put down roots. He marries sweetheart Vida Downey (Vera Miles) and embarks on a lifelong roller-coaster ride as a scoutmaster to a steady stream of high-spirited youngsters. Set against lovingly recreated scenes of 1930s America, this family classic shines with all the warmth and humor of Disney entertainment at its nostalgic best.|The movie marks Kurt Russell\'s Disney film debut, as Whitey.|Variety wrote, "The production catches the spirit of rural America in the \'30s with moving charm, blending comedy, drama, and romance in a buildup toward an emotionally charged climax."']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'ACTION, Comedy, LIVE', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Norman Tokar, Luana Patten, Lillian Gish, Madge Blake, Fred MacMurray, David Bailey, Vera Miles, Bill Booth, Elliot Reid, Louis Pelletier, Johnny Bangert, Kurt Russell, Ken Murray, Tol Avery, Charles Ruggles, Richard BakalyanNorman Tokar, Luana Patten, Lillian Gish, Madge Blake, Fred MacMurray, David Bailey, Vera Miles, Bill Booth, Elliot Reid, Louis Pelletier, Johnny Bangert, Kurt Russell, Ken Murray, Tol Avery, Charles Ruggles, Richard Bakalyan  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 13 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.71 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3357900', 'Director': 'Norman Tokar', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '2 hours and 13 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 3, 2004', 'Actors': 'Fred MacMurray, Vera Miles, Lillian Gish, Charles Ruggles, Kurt Russell', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Louis Pelletier', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: We used to have it on VHS but someone it was taped over part way.  We decided to get it on DVD.  This is a funny and heart warming movie.
Review Title: Great Movie
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
Hot Lead & Cold Feet
Jim Dale  (Actor),     Karen Valentine  (Actor),     Robert Butler  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
["There's magic in the memories as great Disney moments are captured right here for you and your family to enjoy. A two-gun terror and his terrified twin brother turn an old cowtown upside down. A blazing, rip-roaring, riotous saga of brotherly competition in a winner-take-all battle for an inheritance. Jim Dale (PETE'S DRAGON, UNIDENTIFIED FLYING ODDBALL) stars in a triple-header of a role, pulling all the stops out as he plays three different people: Old Jasper Bloodshy and his two sons.|Portions of the film were shot on location in Deschutes National Forest in Oregon, from Snowy Mt. Bachelor along the Cascade Range, across the Deschutes River gorge, to the black rocks of Lava Butte."]

Great Movie
The One and Only, Genuine, Original Family Band
Walter Brennan  (Actor),     Buddy Ebsen  (Actor),     Michael O'Herlihy  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Musicals & Performing Arts, Musicals
['Product Description', 'There\'s magic in the memories as great Disney moments are captured right here for you and your family to enjoy in THE ONE AND ONLY, GENUINE, ORIGINAL FAMILY BAND -- a large slice of Americana set to music and dance. This is the captivating saga of a musical family that homesteads in the Dakota Territory of the 1880s and becomes embroiled in the presidential battle between Grover Cleveland and Benjamin Harrison. A robust, song-filled movie for those who enjoy a good love story, admire a family that sticks together through thick and thin, or respond to rousing, Broadway-style music ... composed by the Academy Award(R) winning Sherman Brothers (1964 Best Score, Best Original Song, MARY POPPINS).|Goldie "Jean" Hawn plays a bit part in this 1968 film, which also features her future significant other, Kurt Russell.', 'Amazon.com', '"All I know is, the Democrats elected a president, and the Republicans cheated \'em out of it!" No, this is not a Michael Moore documentary, but a 1968 Disney musical.', 'The One and Only, Genuine, Original Family Band', 'is probably the best musical comedy set against the 1888 presidential campaign between Grover Cleveland and Benjamin Harrison. The family band, a bit like American prairie Von Trapps, settles in the Dakota territory. Problem is, Grandpappy Walter Brennan is a diehard Democrat, and Dakota is rife with Republicans, including the suitor (John Davidson at his dimpledest) to his granddaughter (Lesley Ann Warren). The score by the Sherman brothers is not their best, and the "family fare" approach almost killed Disney films during this era. Nice to see old hoofer Buddy Ebsen get to dance a bit, and trivia buffs should note that Kurt Russell and Goldie Hawn are first linked here--he\'s one of the kids, she\'s a featured dancer.', '--Robert Horton']

We have it on VHS but wanted it on DVD.  We love this movie.  It is fun to watch.  They do not make musicals like these anymore.
Great Movie
Blackbeard's Ghost
Dean Jones  (Actor),     Peter Ustinov  (Actor),     Robert Stevenson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
['Product Description', "Award-winning actor Peter Ustinov stars in this hilarious fantasy as the ghost of the legendary pirate Blackbeard. The once blackhearted scoundrel materializes in a small New England town, cursed to wander in limbo until he performs a good deed. He gets his chance when he decides to help a local college track team ... that hasn't a ghost of a chance of winning! Blackbeard finds himself full of team spirit, and dispensing his own brand of invisible coaching ... in this warmhearted comedy that will have you laughing from his first fade-in to his final fade-out!|This film featured the second Disney teaming of Suzanne Pleshette and Dean Jones, who scored a hit in 1966's THE UGLY DACHSHUND. They would team up once again in 1976 for THE SHAGGY D.A.", 'Amazon.com', 'In the moody prologue, amid a raging storm that evokes Hollywood golden-age high-seas swashbucklers, a foreboding scroll recounts the legend of one of the bloodiest pirates in the history of the Caribbean. Leave it to Disney to turn him into a fun-loving old prankster with a whimsical side. Peter Ustinov mugs shamelessly as the bombastic but harmless apparition who renounces his wicked ways to become the mischievous school spirit of the local college, much to the annoyance of straight-arrow track coach Dean Jones. Made in the heyday of Disney\x92s live-action family comedies,', "Blackbeard's Ghost", 'is all haphazard but high-energy slapstick and squeaky-clean romance (courtesy of contemporary schoolmarm Suzanne Pleshette) performed with more gumption than grace, but there\x92s a nostalgic innocence to the whole overplayed affair.', '--Sean Axmaker']

If a Man Answers
Sandra Dee  (Actor),     Bobby Darin  (Actor),     Henry Levin  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
['Sandra Dee and Bobby Darin co-star in a devilishly wicked romantic comedy about the lengths people will go to win the game of love. Rich, beautiful and stylish socialite Chantal Stacy (Dee) has just married charming, talented photographer Eugene Wright (Darin). On the advice of her mother, Chantal tries to "train" her man to be the perfect husband. But once he\'s on to her womanly wiles, Eugene answers with some jealousy-baiting tactics in this fun-filled battle of the sexes.Bonus Content:', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer']

Snowball Express
Dean Jones  (Actor),     Nancy Olson  (Actor),     Norman Tokar  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
['Product Description', 'Johnny Baxter (Dean Jones), a New York accountant, inherits a hotel in the Rocky Mountains, quits his job, and moves his family out West to beautiful Colorado. The Rockies never seemed rockier as the Baxters find their "estate" in a state of total dilapidation.|A city ordinance prohibiting snowmobiles on the main street of Crested Butte in the Colorado Rockies had to be temporarily suspended so the crew could film a snowmobile race.', 'Amazon.com', "When New York accountant Johnny Baxter (Dean Jones) learns he has inherited a Colorado hotel, he promptly quits his thankless job, packs up his dubious family, and heads west. Since this is a Disney comedy, the inn's only customers turn out to be nonpaying raccoons and its decorating motif is strictly cobweb. To make matters worse, the local banker not only refuses Baxter a loan, but tries to buy out the desperate newcomer with a lowball figure. But with the help of an eccentric squatter (", 'M*A*S*H', "'s Harry Morgan), a local snowmobile dude, and an avalanche, the city slickers eventually prevail. Jones' slapstick style is showcased in ski and snowmobile scenes featuring vintage 1972 special effects that are nevertheless hysterical to kids. With a G rating, this is safe, relatively entertaining family fare. (Ages 5 and older)", '--Kimberly Heinrichs']

The Moon-Spinners
Hayley Mills  (Actor),     Joan Greenwood  (Actor),     James Neilson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
["Start with a fortune in stolen jewels. Add a dash of danger. A pinch of romance. Season with Hitchcock-like intrigue and comic flair. What do you have? A mystery thriller for the whole family ... with the Disney touch. Set against the sun-bleached beauty of the Isle of Crete, the story pits a young English tourist (Hayley Mills) against a wily Greek jewel thief (Eli Wallach). Mistaken identities and perilous escapes -- including a nail-biting battle with a windmill -- lead the junior-miss detective to a final confrontation aboard the yacht of an eccentric millionairess (Pola Negri) with a passion for priceless gems and pet cheetahs!|Pola Negri, the famous silent film star who hadn't made a film in more than 20 years, was personally coaxed out of retirement by Walt Disney to appear as the treacherous Madame Habib.|This was Peter McEnery's Disney film debut, the success of which landed him the title role in THE FIGHTING PRINCE OF DONEGAL.|The script called for Madame Habib (Pola Negri) to own a Siamese cat, but Negri suggested the character own a cheetah instead. The filmmakers agreed."]

Fun Movie
Summer Magic
Hayley Mills  (Actor),     Dorothy McGuire  (Actor),     James Neilson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
['Hayley Mills brings a joyful enthusiasm to this nostalgic, musical, and bighearted adventure in small-town living, now on Disney DVD. When a close-knit Boston family loses their fortune, they find a wealth of family secrets, young love, and charming summer nights in Beulah, Maine. A good-natured postmaster, pretentious cousin Julia, and the mysterious absentee landlord, Mr. Hamilton, populate their new life in a charming old yellow house. Featuring an all-star supporting cast, including Burl Ives, Dorothy McGuire, and Deborah Walley, this classic and wondrous tale will delight the entire family and belongs in every Disney collection.|This film is based on the novel "Mother Carey\'s Chickens," by Kate Douglas, which has become an American classic.']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Format Preference:** Continues to favor DVDs while phasing out VHS, demonstrating an ongoing commitment to enhancing viewing quality and preserving a collection of classic films.

- **Genre Affinity:** Maintains a strong preference for family-friendly action, comedy, and musical genres, particularly whimsical romantic comedies and light-hearted narratives that evoke nostalgia and humor.

- **Viewing Frequency:** Values rewatchable films and treasures timeless classics, as recent additions align with a passion for nostalgia-infused storytelling and family comedies.

- **Emotional Engagement:** Actively seeks films that blend humor, magic, and adventure, showcasing a love for comedic elements and engaging tales, as highlighted by recent purchases that reflect these themes.

- **Ratings Behavior:** Consistently provides positive ratings, averaging 4.7, indicating a discerning taste for quality entertainment that resonates with personal nostalgia.

- **Purchase Behavior:** Frequently engages with renowned studios like Disney, underscoring an enduring interest in films featuring celebrated actors and Americana themes.

- **Family-Oriented:** Emphasizes a commitment to family-centric films, combining joy, humor, and romance, as reflected in positive interactions with nostalgic titles; recent acquisitions strengthen this focus on creating delightful family viewing experiences. 

This updated profile reveals a deepened appreciation for classic storytelling, with a clear emphasis on humor and emotional warmth, reinforcing past behavior patterns of valuing rewatchability and family-friendly content.
